did.abstract: Correspondence and genealogical information concerning the Fyfe family of Lansing, Michigan, including letters from Jennie Fyfe a Civil War nurse and teacher in a Black school in Paducah Kentucky.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright to the collection has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder, Fyfe Family Papers, Bentley Historical Library.

bioghist.p: Jennie Fyfe, of Lansing, Michigan, served as a nurse in the Civil War and as a teacher in a black school in Paducah, Kentucky.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence, March 31, 1864, to June 17, 1866, from Jennie Fyfe to her sister, Mrs. Ellen Mott, and other family members; obituaries of Mary A. Miles; and genealogical notes of Mrs. Della Miles Bertch concerning John Fyfe and other family members. It also includes a photograph of Jennie Fyfe.

note.p: (Information regarding provenance prepared by Mary E. Mott regarding the correspondence in this folder and notarized by Charles Hopkins, Clerk, Supreme Court of Michigan.April 29, 1893)

did.unittitle: Correspondence from Jennie Fyfe to her sister, Ellen Mott, and to her father and family in general, March 31, 1864-June 17, 1866
Papers concerning the genealogy of the families of John Fyfe, John Strong, John Perry, Robert Gray, John Gilbert, John Miles, and James Prescott, 1899-1923 and undated
Genealogical materials largely concerning Della M. Bertch, 1904-1942

scopecontent.p: The photographs include a portrait of Jennie Fyfe as an old woman, an unidentified group photo, bathing scene with Richard Fyfe present, and portriat of Della Fyfe Miles.
